required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: GR1405 Injection in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumor or Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Study for Evaluating the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Preliminary Efficacy of Repeated Doses, Dose Escalation of GR1405 Injection in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumor or Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase I clinical study for evaluating the safety, pharmacokinetics, and preliminary efficacy of repeated doses, dose escalation of GR1405 injection in patients with advanced solid tumor or lymphoma

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the tolerability, safety, pharmacokinetics, and preliminary efficacy of GR1405 injection monotherapy in an open, non-controlled, escalating trial design in patients with advanced solid tumors or lymphomas. Four dose levels (3 mg/kg, 10 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg, and 30 mg/kg) were evaluated at this stage.

primary_outcome.description: Maximum tolerated dose of GR1405 injection
Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events as Assessed by CTCAE v4.03

secondary_outcome.description: the maximum exposure to a biologically active physica
DOR by RECIST v. 1.1 or Lugano 2014, the time between the initial response to therapy and subsequent disease progression or relapse
Objective Response Rate(ORR) by RECIST v. 1.1 or Lugano 2014, ORR=complete response(CR) + partial response(PR)

Progression free survival(PFS) by RECIST v. 1.1 or Lugano 2014, a patient lives with the disease but it does not get worse. In a clinical trial, measuring the progression-free survival is one way to see how well a new treatment works
the ability to elicit an immune response of GR1405 injection,

secondary_outcome.measure: Recommended dose for Phase II trial(RP2D)
secondary_outcome.description: The MTD is one dose level below the lowest dose tested in which 2 or more patients experienced dose-limiting toxicity(DLT) attributable to the study drug. The MTD will be the RP2D
Area under the curve in the period from 0 to t
Area under the curve in the period from 0 to ∞
Area under the curve of Steady-State Plasma Concentrations
the time of occurrence of peak drug concentration
the time of half-life of the drug
the volume of fluid that would be required to contain the amount of drug in the body
the rate of elimination of the drug in vivo

arm_group.description: According to the patient's weight, the dose of this group is 3mg/kg.
According to the patient's weight, the dose of this group is 10mg/kg.
According to the patient's weight, the dose of this group is 20mg/kg.
According to the patient's weight, the dose of this group is 30mg/kg.

intervention.description: Intravenous administration according to the patient's weight. All dose groups were administered once every 2 weeks.

facility.name: Cancer Institute/Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences & Peking Union Medical College
